title: Star Wars Jedi Knight II: Jedi Outcast
notes: I can verify that the game works with launch options: MESA_EXTENSION_MAX_YEAR=2003 %command%

title: STAR WARS™ Jedi Knight II - Jedi Outcast™
notes:
Winedb rating: Silver. Game runs perfectly, but you need exactly the same workarounds as for Jedi Academy (and possibly one more):

1) Use following launch options:
NVIDIA proprietary drivers users:
__GL_ExtensionStringVersion=17700 %command%
AMD/Intel users might try: (not tested)
MESA_EXTENSION_MAX_YEAR=2003 %command%

2) To avoid mouse glitch, force native resolution of your display: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=219908767

3) If in fullscreen you experience "grey filter", or game is too dark or too bright - use following tweak: shift+tilde to open in-game console, type "r_overBrightBits 0" and restart game.

The single real issue is hidden mouse cursor in Steam Overlay. Multiplayer was not tested.

title: STAR WARS™ Jedi Knight II: Jedi Outcast™
notes: Crash on startup. However, just like with Wine, setting the environment variable __GL_ExtensionStringVersion=17700 allows the game to run flawlessly, but mouse sensitivity feels really weird (this is not an issue when running on Wine).

title: STAR WARS™ Jedi Knight II: Jedi Outcast™

notes: Had to set the launch options to "__GL_ExtensionStringVersion=17700 %command%", or else the game would crash at launch. Also, the resolution settings are ignored in fullscreen mode (defaults to 640x480) but work in windowed mode. Game runs fine otherwise.
